name: Acute Mesenteric Ischemia
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain that came on suddenly
prognosis: Poor if not treated immediately; mortality rate remains high even with treatment
description: Acute mesenteric ischemia is a life-threatening vascular emergency caused by sudden interruption of blood flow to the small intestine, typically due to embolism, thrombosis, or non-occlusive ischemia. It requires rapid diagnosis and intervention to prevent bowel necrosis.
